page.title: 03THE RIVER HULL
page.content: The River Hull cuts through the centre of the area flowing north to south. A number of small industries cluster along the banks of the river but the main impression is of decay. Though there are many small businesses there are large areas of abandoned properties and dereliction. The River Hull is still important for trade, barges still ply the tidal waterway, some as far as Beverley ten miles away, but the bulk of the industry has gone. The effect of this on the community is devastating. The industrial collapse combined with the disintegration of Hull's Fishing Industry has led to an unemployment level in excess of 50% in certain sections of this area.
